artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō

description: woman looking over her PR shoulder, with her lower lip protruding and mouth slightly open, holding a tube shaped red and yellow object (pipe?) vertically with both hands; woman wears and brown and black checked kimono with black and purple collars; brown kettle at right; black and grey cloth with red text behind woman in ULQ
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田彫勇 {Wada hori Yū}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 19 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Bewildered, Behavior of a Fireman's Wife of the Kaei Era
